Description: Small stone object in the shape of a lion in a crouched position, that was probably used as a weight. It is carved relatively rough, the shape is quite stylized except for the head. In the area of the neck a perforation that was drilled from both sides, getting thinner from an outer diameter of 0.7 to 0.2 cm. Black and white breccia stone.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 131)
